section.names: upgrading\ from\ godot\ 4.0\ to\ godot\ 4.1 doc_upgrading_to_godot_4.1
section.title: Upgrading from Godot 4.0 to Godot 4.1
section.paragraph: For most games and apps made with 4.0, it should be relatively safe to migrate to 4.1. This page intends to cover everything you need to pay attention to when migrating your project.

section.title: Breaking changes
section.paragraph: If you are migrating from 4.0 to 4.1, the breaking changes listed here might affect you. Changes are grouped by areas/systems.

warning.paragraph: The GDExtension API completely breaks compatibility in 4.1, so it's not included in the table below. See the Updating your GDExtension for 4.1 section for more information.

section.paragraph: This article indicates whether each breaking change affects GDScript and whether the C# breaking change is binary compatible or source compatible:

list_item.paragraph: Binary compatible - Existing binaries will load and execute successfully without recompilation, and the runtime behavior won't change.
Source compatible - Source code will compile successfully without changes when upgrading Godot.

section.title: Behavior changes
section.paragraph: In 4.1, some behavior changes have been introduced, which might require you to adjust your project.

entry.paragraph: When input events should reach SubViewports and their children, SubViewportContainer.mouse_filter now needs to be MOUSE_FILTER_STOP or MOUSE_FILTER_PASS. See GH-79271 for details.
Multiple layered SubViewportContainer nodes, that should all receive mouse input events, now need to be replaced by Area2D nodes. See GH-79128 for details.
Viewport nodes, that have Physics Picking enabled, now automatically set InputEvents as handled. See GH-79897 for workarounds.

abbreviation.explanation: This API does not break compatibility.
This API does not break compatibility. A compatibility method was added.

section.title: Updating your GDExtension for 4.1
section.paragraph: In order to fix a serious bug, in Godot 4.1 we had to break binary compatibility in a big way and source compatibility in a small way.
This means that GDExtensions made for Godot 4.0 will need to be recompiled for Godot 4.1 (using the 4.1 branch of godot-cpp), with a small change to their source code.
In Godot 4.0, your "entry_symbol" function looks something like this:
However, for Godot 4.1, it should look like:

list_item.paragraph: The first argument changes from const GDExtensionInterface *p_interface to GDExtensionInterfaceGetProcAddress p_get_proc_address
The constructor for the init_obj variable now receives p_get_proc_address as its first parameter

section.paragraph: You also need to add an extra compatibility_minimum line to your .gdextension file, so that it looks something like:
This lets Godot know that your GDExtension has been updated and is safe to load in Godot 4.1.
